title: How to install Android apps on Windows 11
description: Windows 11 supports Android apps through the Amazon Appstore, but getting everything set up is tricky. Here's how to install Android apps on Windows 11.

title: The situation with melting RTX 4090 connectors just got more complicated
description: The saga of RTX 4090 GPUs burning up continues. Many people thought it was over, but using an adapter left some users with a broken GPU and a denied RMA claim.

title: Spotify is testing the removal of a popular feature from its free tier
description: In a bid to nudge more people toward paying for its music streaming service, Spotify is testing the removal of a popular feature from the free tier.

title: Amazon tweaks in-garage delivery option, so now you might have to pay
description: Amazon's In-Garage Delivery option is currently free no matter what day you have a package delivered, but from next month that will change.

title: MSI just fixed a massive problem affecting Intel’s best CPUs
description: MSI just managed to fix a major problem that got some users stuck in a spiral of computer crashes. Here's what you need to know to avoid this issue.

title: FAA gives UPS’ drone delivery efforts a big boost
description: UPS' drone delivery ambitions have been given a significant boost following a key decision by the Federal Aviation Administration.

title: GoPro unveils its latest action camera, the Hero 12 Black
description: Unveiled on Wednesday, GoPro's new Hero 12 Black action camera offers a few notable upgrades that include a significant boost to battery life.

title: Security or performance? With this AMD vulnerability, you can’t have both
description: This AMD Zen 2 vulnerability has the potential to steal your passwords, but if you want a fix, you'll need to make a tough decision.

title: The squishy Sensiworm robot goes places other robots can’t
description: GE Aerospace has unveiled a remarkable -- and remarkably squishy -- robot called Sensiworm that’s set to enhance aircraft safety.

title: Steam Deck 2? This leak suggests Valve is working on new hardware
description: It seems that Valve might have a new device up its sleeve, but what is it going to be? Are we due for a Steam Deck 2 yet, or is it something else?
